The painting style of Max Beckmann embraced many diverse movements of twentieth- century art Ã¢â‚¬â€ German Impressionism, Gothic formalism, modern Classicism, Expressionism, New ObjectivityÃ¢â‚¬â€for none, singly, was sufficient to accommodate the breadth of his genius. 
Beckmann transcended his time and culture as few of his contemporaries have. Richly diverse influences merge in his work : the grim and tortured imagery of Griinewald, 
Bruegel, and Bosch; the synthesis of reality and abstraction perfected by Cezanne; the fragmentation of form pursued by the Cubists; the coloristic exuberance of Matisse; medieval and classical iconography
